page.title: 13POPULATION/EMPLOYMENT-EGMERE
page.content: Comparatively few people live in this area: the{population}does not exceed 60. There are{twenty-four households of between one and five persons. Four couples are elderly and two younger couples live here. The majority of people are middle aged. Of the eight {children}of school age, two are being educated privately and live away during termtime. Eight sons and daughters of working age live with their parents. Most{adolescents}feel that they will leave the area when they get married. All men of working age in the area are in employment. One works only three days a week. He would like to work full time but would lose too much of his pension in tax. Only two wives are at work. Three men have retired. The other men work on the farms (including four managers) or at Seaman's Animal Feeds Mill.
